org.phantomapi.construct

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phantomapi.construct.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener, Controllable, ControllerMessenger
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncDataController, BungeeController, ChanneledExecutivePoolController, CommandController, CommandRegistryController, ConfigurableController, DataController, DefaultController, DevelopmentController, DMS, EditSessionController, EventRippler, HotLoadController, MonitorController, MySQLConnectionController, NestController, NotificationController, PhotonController, PlaceholderController, ProtocolController, ResourceController, TestController, WraithController

    public abstract class Controller
extends Object
implements Controllable, ControllerMessenger
    A controller

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(Controllable parentController)
        Create a controller as a subcontroller from the parent controller. Tick rates ARE AFFECTED. For example, if the parent controler tickrate is one tick per second (20tps), and your tickrate is 0 or 1, your tick rate will actually be 1 tick per second instead of every tick. This is because the parent controller ticks your controller. Also, if the parent controller is not ticked, then this controller can not tick even with the ticked annotation
        Parameters:
        parentController - the parent controller

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Start the controller. This starts all sub controllers first before starting itself. Do not override this unless you know what you are doing. Override the onStart()
        Specified by:
        start in interface Controllable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Stop the controller. Stops the controller by disabling all sub controllers, then stopping itself after. Do not override this unless you know what you are doing. Override the onStop method
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Controllable

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Tick the controler. This is called by a phantom provider in the plugin holding this controller. To get this to fire, either tick it, or use @Ticked(interval) on this class
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Controllable

      • onStart

        public abstract void onStart()
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Override for start. Called when this controller is starting up. This could be called async. If you need it sync, either use S.class, or annotate @SyncStart for this class
        Specified by:
        onStart in interface Controllable

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Reload the controller and all subcontrollers. Simply calls stop(), then start() following the process of controller structure. Before this happens, onReload is called.
        Specified by:
        reload in interface Controllable

        public void onPostStop()
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Called after onstop. This is called for any last minute things that need to be done. You cannot schedule tasks here (they would die before they start)
        Specified by:
        onPostStop in interface Controllable

      • getController

        public Controllable getController(String name)
        Description copied from interface: Controllable
        Get any controller on the server by name. This allows you to get controllers from other plugins on the same server even if it is not in your classpath. You can then send this controller a message in a datacluster format to transfer data back and fourth. It is much faster than reflection.
        Specified by:
        getController in interface Controllable
        Parameters:
        name - the controller name (class.getSimpleName)
        Returns:
        the controller or null if not found
